item.title: Bus Topology
item.description: Bus topology allows information to be directed from one computer to the other. Lots of binary collisions in the network Examples Shared landline connections Ethernet network Resource sharing network

item.title: Full Mesh Topology
item.description: In full mesh topology all the computers in the network needs to have connections with all the other computers

item.title: Half Mesh Topology
item.description: In half mesh computers have multiple connections but not with all the computers Examples CDN networks (content delivery networks ) Peripheral network connected to a full mesh backbone

item.title: Mesh Topology
item.description: Computers are connected in a mesh multiple interconnections between each computer There area two types of mesh topologies

item.title: Ring Topology
item.description: Ring topology uses a token to pass information from one computer to the other A token is attached by the sender to the message to identify which computer needs to receive the message

item.title: Star Topology
item.description: Star topology is the most common type used. All computers are attached to a hub. Less collision and more efficient
